snippet: Mr. Hoffman was among his generation’s most ambitious and admired American actors, playing sidekicks, villains and lead roles on stage and in film.
abstract: Philip Seymour Hoffman, perhaps most ambitious and widely admired American actor of his generation, dies at age 46; was known for giving three-dimensional nuance to wide range of sidekicks, villains and leading men on screen and for embracing some of theater's most burdensome roles on Broadway.

byline.contributor: Annie Correal, Emma G. Fitzsimmons, J. David Goodman, Dave Itzkoff and Michael Cieply contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Hoffman was among his generation’s most ambitious and admired American actors, playing sidekicks, villains and lead roles on stage and in film.

headline.main: Philip Seymour Hoffman, Actor of Depth, Dies at 46
headline.print_headline: Actor of Depth, Fearless in His Choice of Roles
